resources.title: Understand TCP/IP addressing and subnetting basics
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation explaining the fundamentals of IP addresses, network classes, and how subnet masks are used to divide networks. It covers binary and dotted-decimal notation.

resources.title: IP Addressing and Subnetting for New Users
resources.description: A comprehensive and classic written tutorial from Cisco that covers the basics of IP addressing, network masks, and subnetting with detailed examples and sample exercises, including VLSM and CIDR.

resources.title: Subnetting Practice Questions
resources.description: An interactive website that provides a wide variety of randomly generated subnetting practice questions. Users can practice identifying network addresses, broadcast addresses, and valid host ranges to build speed and accuracy.

resources.title: IP Subnetting tutorial | How to subnet IPv4 addresses
resources.description: A detailed video tutorial that walks through the entire process of subnetting IPv4 addresses. It covers IP address classes, binary numbers, subnet masks, CIDR notation, and how to calculate network and broadcast IPs.

packs.subdomain: Routing Table Concepts and Static Routing

resources.title: IP Routing: Static Configuration Guide
resources.description: Official Cisco documentation detailing the concepts and commands for configuring static IP routing on Cisco IOS devices. It covers basic static routes, default routes, and floating static routes.
resources.source_subdomain: Routing Table Concepts and Static Routing

resources.title: Configure Static Routes | Junos OS
resources.description: Comprehensive official guide from Juniper Networks on understanding and configuring static routes in Junos OS. It covers IPv4 and IPv6 static routing with configuration examples.
resources.source_subdomain: Routing Table Concepts and Static Routing

resources.title: How to configure Static Routes & Default Routes on Cisco Routers
resources.description: A step-by-step video tutorial demonstrating the configuration of static and default routes on Cisco routers using the command-line interface (CLI). The tutorial uses a simple network topology to explain the concepts.
resources.source_subdomain: Routing Table Concepts and Static Routing

resources.title: Static Route Configuration on Cisco Routers
resources.description: A written tutorial that walks through a static routing configuration example on Cisco routers. It includes the necessary commands and verification steps, making it a good hands-on exercise for beginners.
resources.source_subdomain: Routing Table Concepts and Static Routing

resources.title: Routing Table Explained
resources.description: A clear and concise video explaining the fundamentals of a routing table. It covers how to read a real routing table on a Cisco router, explaining the different codes (like 'S' for static) and components.
resources.source_subdomain: Routing Table Concepts and Static Routing

resources.title: Fundamentals of 802.1Q VLAN Tagging
resources.description: Official Cisco Meraki documentation explaining the fundamental concepts of VLANs, including the 802.1Q tagging process, common terms like trunk and access ports, and best practices for VLAN configuration.

resources.title: CCNA VLAN Lab: Configuring Segmented and Secured Networks in Cisco Packet Tracer
resources.description: A detailed, step-by-step hands-on lab guide using Cisco Packet Tracer to simulate a real-world scenario. It covers creating VLANs, assigning ports, configuring trunk links between switches, and verifying the configuration.

resources.title: Configuring VLAN Tagging | Junos OS
resources.description: Official Juniper Networks documentation that explains how VLANs work and provides configuration details for single-tagged, dual-tagged (Q-in-Q), and mixed-tagged frames on devices running Junos OS.

resources.title: VLANs Made Easy: Learn This Today!
resources.description: A comprehensive video tutorial that breaks down the basics of what VLANs are, why they are used, and how they work. It covers concepts like tagged vs. untagged traffic and trunk ports, and includes practical demonstrations on both consumer and enterprise-grade equipment.

resources.title: Virtual LANs (VLANs) - EOS
resources.description: Arista's official documentation for configuring VLANs and Switch Virtual Interfaces (SVIs) on their EOS-based switches. It covers creating VLANs, configuring access and trunk ports, and other related features.

resources.title: Azure Virtual Network Integration for Service Network Isolation
resources.description: Official Microsoft documentation explaining how Azure virtual network integration enables secure isolation and control of access to Azure services. It covers various methods like dedicated service deployment, Private Endpoints, and service endpoints.

resources.title: Network Segmentation Virtual Lab
resources.description: A hands-on virtual lab where you create three distinct network areas, route traffic accordingly, and secure VPN access. This lab helps in understanding how segmentation can protect a network from widespread attacks and improve performance.

resources.title: Network Segmentation in Azure: Step-by-Step Guide
resources.description: A detailed, step-by-step written tutorial on implementing a hub-and-spoke network segmentation architecture in Azure using VNets, subnets, Network Security Groups (NSGs), and Azure Firewall.

resources.title: Implementing Network Segmentation & Micro-Segmentation on AWS
resources.description: This tutorial provides a practical walkthrough of implementing both macro-segmentation (VPCs, Subnets, NACLs, Security Groups) and micro-segmentation (using AWS VPC Lattice) in a realistic 3-tier architecture on AWS.

resources.title: SD-Access Segmentation Design Guide
resources.description: A comprehensive design guide from Cisco on implementing network segmentation using its Software-Defined Access (SD-Access) solution. It covers Virtual Networks (VNs) and Security Group Tags (SGTs) for macro and micro-segmentation.

packs.subdomain: DNS Resolution Process and Record Types

resources.title: What is DNS?
resources.description: A comprehensive series of articles from Cloudflare's Learning Center that explains the Domain Name System. It covers the step-by-step DNS lookup process, the roles of different DNS servers, caching, and detailed explanations of common DNS record types.
resources.source_subdomain: DNS Resolution Process and Record Types

resources.title: Reviewing DNS Concepts
resources.description: Official documentation from Microsoft that clearly explains the process of DNS name resolution, including recursive and iterative queries. It uses helpful diagrams to illustrate how resolution works with both root hints and forwarders.
resources.source_subdomain: DNS Resolution Process and Record Types

resources.title: Mess with DNS
resources.description: An interactive, hands-on playground where you can experiment with creating and querying DNS records for a real subdomain. This tool allows you to safely learn how different record types work and see the results of your changes using the `dig` command.
resources.source_subdomain: DNS Resolution Process and Record Types

resources.title: How to Use nslookup and dig to Verify and Troubleshoot DNS
resources.description: A practical, step-by-step written guide on using the essential command-line tools `nslookup` and `dig` to query DNS records. It provides clear examples for checking different record types, querying specific servers, and performing reverse lookups.
resources.source_subdomain: DNS Resolution Process and Record Types

resources.title: DNS record types
resources.description: A detailed reference guide from Cloudflare's official documentation. It provides a clear and extensive list of DNS record types with explanations of what each record does, its required fields, and how it's used.
resources.source_subdomain: DNS Resolution Process and Record Types
